SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Level.LevelView

Class LevelView

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Level.LevelView.LevelView
Direct Known Subclasses:
LevelViewLevelFour, LevelViewLevelOne, LevelViewLevelThree, LevelViewLevelTwo
public class LevelView extends Object
Represents the view layer of the level, responsible for displaying hearts, win and game over images, and updating the UI as the game progresses.

This class manages and displays the UI elements related to the game's status, including heart icons (representing the player's health), the win image (shown when the player wins), and the game over image (shown when the player loses). It also provides methods to update and remove hearts based on the player's health.

  • Field Details

    • HEART_DISPLAY_X_POSITION

      private static final double HEART_DISPLAY_X_POSITION
      The X position of the heart display on the screen. This constant defines where the heart display (representing the player's health) will be positioned horizontally.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      private static final double HEART_DISPLAY_Y_POSITION
      The Y position of the heart display on the screen. This constant defines where the heart display (representing the player's health) will be positioned vertically.

    • root

      private final javafx.scene.Group root
      The root container of the scene where the UI elements will be added. This is a Group that holds all the UI elements for the game level.

    • winImage

      private final WinImage winImage
      The image displayed when the player wins the level. This represents the victory condition and shows an image indicating that the player has won the game.

    • gameOverImage

      private final GameOverImage gameOverImage
      The image displayed when the player loses the game. This represents the game over condition and shows an image indicating that the player has lost the game.

    • heartDisplay

      private final HeartDisplay heartDisplay
      The display for the player's hearts, representing the player's health. This object manages the heart icons that represent the player's current health.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelView

      public LevelView(javafx.scene.Group root, int heartsToDisplay)
      Constructs a LevelView instance with the specified root group and number of hearts to display. This view manages the display of heart icons, win image, and game over image.

      The constructor initializes the heart display, win image, and game over image based on the provided root container and the number of hearts the player starts with.

      Parameters:
      root - the root container of the scene where the UI elements will be added.
      heartsToDisplay - the initial number of hearts to be displayed.

  • Method Details

    • showHeartDisplay

      public void showHeartDisplay()
      Displays the heart display on the screen, showing the current number of hearts.

      This method adds the heart display to the root container so that the player's health (represented by heart icons) is visible in the UI.

    • showWinImage

      public void showWinImage()
      Displays the win image on the screen when the player wins the level.

      This method adds the win image to the root container and calls the method to show the win image.

    • showGameOverImage

      public void showGameOverImage()
      Displays the game over image on the screen when the player loses the game.

      This method adds the game over image to the root container to signal the end of the game.

    • removeHearts

      public void removeHearts(int heartsRemaining)
      Removes hearts from the display when the player's health decreases.

      This method adjusts the heart display by removing heart icons based on the remaining number of hearts.

      Parameters:
      heartsRemaining - the current number of hearts to display after removal.

    • addHearts

      public void addHearts(int heartsRemaining)
      Adds hearts to the display when the player's health increases.

      This method adjusts the heart display by adding heart icons based on the remaining number of hearts.

      Parameters:
      heartsRemaining - the current number of hearts to display after addition.
